header.title: Fury over fake photo of Greta Thunberg eating lunch in front of poor children
header.postText: The son of Brazil’s controversial president Jair Bolsonaro has faced criticism for sharing a fake photo of teenage activist Greta Thunberg eating lunch in front of poor-looking children.', 'Eduardo Bolsonaro, who is bidding to become the Brazilian Ambassador to the United States, shared the image on Twitter.', 'In a speech at the UN on Monday, Thunberg, 16, who has inspired millions to protest against climate change, accused world leaders of ‘stealing her childhood’.', 'The Swedish teenager has, however, repeatedly faced criticism from right wing politicians and commentators as well as abuse from trolls on social media.', 'Thunberg was originally pictured eating food on a train with forest in the background and the caption ‘lunch in Denmark’.', 'But Bolsonaro, a federal deputy in Sao Paulo, shared a post which featured an edited version of the photo showing hungry-looking children looking through the window as Thunberg eats her food.', 'The president’s son wrote: ‘You stole my childhood said the girl financed by George Soros’ Open Society.’', 'The post featured an article suggesting Thunberg receives funding from George Soros, but reports state there is nothing to suggest she is funded by the Hungarian-American billionaire.', 'Many right-wing conspiracy theorists are convinced Soros is the secret leader of some all-powerful group of liberals which have a massive influence on global affairs.', 'Brazilian Senator Eliziane Gama, who forms part of the Foreign Relations commission which will decide whether to asses Bolsonaro’s application to be the new ambassador to the United States, described the post as ‘great irresponsibility’.', 'She added: ‘Fake news today is an evil which must be combated in every democratic society in the world.', '‘It’s something that we do not accept, and it is accepted even less when it is done by a public representative.', '‘It’s lamentable, and I think the deputy needs to retract it, make an apology to the 16-year-old and to both the Brazilian and international society.’', 'Another post on Twitter which drew thousands of responses slammed Thunberg over the same photo for having ‘processed food’, but was later deleted following a backlash.', 'This week Prince Harry praised the Scandinavian campaigner and backed her concerns about climate change.', 'Prince Harry said: ‘This last week, led by Greta, the world’s children are striking.', '‘There is an emergency. It’s a race against time and one in which we are losing, and everyone knows it.', '‘I don’t believe there is anybody in this world that can deny science, undeniable science and facts.’
header.socioLingVar: Age - Youngsters,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments,Age - Over 65s

commentThread.commentText: I am so sorry but do I see plastic with her lunch?

replies.commentText: It should be the government duty to ban plastic not hers. Plastic is highly toxic for human and especially for animals. Government only care about businesses not the people and living creatures. Poor Greta shouldn't be in the picture. Plastic is nothing to do with her.
Do as I say, not as I do.

Yep.I don't see a point to your comment, though. Obviously, you're attempting to paint her out as a hypocrite, but that would make you someone who can't tell the difference between urging industry to find alternatives to plastic, and buying food at a station that is in plastic because industry hasn't caught up with this change yet.Don't worry, Tim is just as confused and paranoid as you are. Poor wee things.

Bat Fastard - What's with the insults and hate? It's like people want to carry on as normal and welcome climate change. I really don't get it. She has Aspergers (not a retard) and has everyone talking an important issue. Pretty impressive by my standards.

I'm not confused.  I know my existence is contributing to climate change.  The difference is I don't bang on about how everyone should change their behaviour whilst I go on as before.  There's a lot of hypocracy.Take Sir David Attenborough for example.  I wonder how many air miles he's got under his belt making his nature programs all over the world.  Then he lectures about CO2 production and climate change.
Nope just preach what you speech! I'm not painting her to be anything, she is, I just pointed out something
Bat Fastard Been drinking again?

She had to fly her sailing crew & herself back and forth from the U.S. to Europe all the while she's telling us we stole her poor priveleged childhood of yahting & international stardom & travel. Wake up. She's a propoganda piece created for "consumption" by fools, backed by international bankers such as Soros et al.

Make it look easy, instead of posting "government make us, bc it's too easy so we can't stop ourselves"
When you buy food on a train, you have limited options.

commentThread.commentText: I think the fury should be directed at the people who think it's a good idea to use a clearly unstable person to push their agenda. I'm all for action in regards to climate issues however I find it difficult to watch someone like this girl being used as a pawn.

replies.commentText: Only people who have never read her speeches and interviews think that she could be "mentally unstable."  As a Ph.D. scientist, I am completely impressed by her understanding of the science.  Even though she has been striking on Friday's it's not surprising that she is no. 1 academically at her school in Sweden.  She carefully avoids taking about politics or specific policies, but focuses on climate science.  Her focus and disipline are amazing.

Bill DeMott ahh the age >old argument of if you don't agree with me then you must be a moron.Fyi I've read her pieces and have watched her interviews and that's how I've drawn my conclusion that she's unstable. I totally admit that what she is saying is right however it's the issue of her being put up on a stage by her supporters to be a mouthpiece that I have an issue with. As far as I'm concerned using a person wit h mental health issues is just plan morally wrong and I don't need a PhD to know that.

commentThread.commentText: LOL.

The trick photo is irony. This girl is cynical. She says that her dreams have been stolen, when she is a white girl from one of the richest countries on the planet. She lives with bourgeois comfort, bourgeois comfort that 90% of the children of the planet do not have.

replies.commentText: So she must be quiet? She cannot have an opinion?She has every right to be cynical, do you even know what that means? If people who live in wealthy countries (a vast majority of which are far from wealthy) said and did nothing where would we be?
corporations normally pay someone to shill as hard as you, but here you are doing it for free....

commentThread.commentText: Everyone who thought they were a child at 16 or 14 or 12 raise their hand. Seriously. I think of them as children now, but I didn't think of myself as a child then. That's what makes it seem false to me. I guess that's where the mental issues come in, idk. All the plastic in the picture is amusing.

replies.commentText: Here's a question, when you were 14 or so, did you see the warnings all over the sky and ground, press, all of the pollution slowly encroaching upon you, and as an adult, ask "Why didn't I say something?"? Then said "Meh, it'll be someone else's problem." and started adding to it?
Think about it. What did you do? When I was 8, I started printing environmentalist literature (this was in 1979). I did something. Largely ignored, perhaps, but at least I did SOMETHING.

commentThread.commentText: To me the edit with the starving kids watching is making an important statement. I agree with climate change and I don't share the hate of this kid but this meme is showing the irony of how a child of affluent parents who believes she is the voice of every child when she is from a privelaged background. There are children across the world who are malnourished and climate change isn't on their mind. She's lucky to be able to fear for our world when there are kids out there who's only fear right now is surviving another day while she is living a jet set lifestyle telling everyone else how the world is. This isn't a joke, this is reality. I'd you missed the point you need to look around yourself. The world really is suffering and so are many children too.

replies.commentText: Throughout history it is mostly affluent & educated who bring about change. I dont get angry at educated or wealthy people who are tgrying to make positive  change. Its a good thing. Blimey we cant leave it to Governments.
WELL SAID @ALLAN BANCROFT.... THE HYPOCRISY IS REAL....
